name: Areca Palm
definition: Dypsis lutescens is a clumping, tropical palm tree known for its slender, arching fronds with feathery leaflets and yellowish stems. It’s widely grown as an ornamental plant for indoor decor and outdoor landscaping in warm climates.
origin: Native to Madagascar (eastern and northwestern regions); it has been naturalized in parts of Southeast Asia, Australia, and the Caribbean.
type: The type species of the genus Dypsis is Dypsis pinnatifrons (not D. lutescens). D. lutescens is a prominent species within the genus but not the type.
synonyms: Chrysalidocarpus lutescens H.Wendl. (most common former name)
benefits: Air purification: Removes formaldehyde, benzene, and trichloroethylene (per NASA’s clean air study).
Ornamental value: Enhances indoor/outdoor aesthetics with its lush, tropical look.
Humidity regulation: Adds moisture to indoor air.
Non-toxic: Safe for cats and dogs (per ASPCA).
Soil stabilization: Helps prevent erosion in outdoor plantings.
lifeSpan: Indoor: Typically 10–20 years with proper care (bright light, regular watering, well-drained soil).
Outdoor (tropical climates): Can live 20–50 years or more, forming large, dense clumps over time.

name: Aloe vera (L.) Burm. F.
definition: Aloe vera is a stemless or short-stemmed succulent plant in the Asphodelaceae family, known for its thick, fleshy, serrated leaves that contain a gel-rich in bioactive compounds. It’s widely cultivated for medicinal, cosmetic, and ornamental use.
origin: Native to the Arabian Peninsula; it grows wild in tropical, subtropical, and arid regions worldwide and is naturalized in many areas (considered invasive in some). Historical records link its use to ancient Mesopotamia, Egypt, and Greece.
type: The type species of the genus Aloe is Aloe perfoliata (not A. vera). A. vera is a well-known species but not the type
benefits: Topical use: Soothes sunburns, skin irritation, rashes, and minor wounds; moisturizes skin and promotes healing.
Hair care: Nourishes scalp, reduces dandruff, and strengthens hair.
Internal use (with caution): Aids digestion, may regulate blood sugar (consult a doctor first), and provides antioxidants.
Ornamental: Easy to grow indoors as a potted plant.
lifeSpan: Indoor/outdoor: With proper care (well-drained soil, bright light, moderate watering), it can live 20 years or more. In ideal tropical conditions, some plants survive decades.

name: Madagascar periwinkle
definition: Madagascar periwinkle is an evergreen, tender, erect-to-spreading perennial in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae). It is native to Madagascar but has naturalized in warm areas around the world. The species epithet means 'pink.'
origin: Native to the island of Madagascar.
scientificClass: Species: Catharanthus roseus (L.) G. Don - Madagascar periwinkle
type: evergreen, tender, erect-to-spreading perennial in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae)
benefits: European herbalists have used periwinkle for headaches, vertigo, and poor memory since medieval times.
Source of anti-cancer medicines vinblastine, vincristine and vinorelbine which are used in chemotherapy.
Antioxidant activity, which helps protect against environmental stress and cellular damage.
lifeSpan: Perennial, but often grown as an annual or semi-annual plant depending on climate and maintenance.

name: False Ashoka Tree
definition: A tall, evergreen tree known for its slender, columnar growth habit and wavy-edged leaves.
origin: Native to India and Sri Lanka.
benefits: Ornamental tree for landscaping, especially in urban areas.
Acts as a natural sound barrier and windbreak.
Provides shade due to its dense foliage.

name: Ramgoat Dashalong
definition: Turnera ulmifolia is a perennial, woody herb or erect shrub in the Passifloraceae (formerly Turneraceae) family. It’s recognized by its lanceolate/ovate serrated leaves and bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that open in the morning and close by afternoon. It’s valued for ornamental and medicinal uses.
origin: Native to the Caribbean basin, Mexico, Central America, and South America (from Mexico to Argentina). It’s naturalized in tropical/subtropical regions worldwide (e.g., Southeast Asia, Australia, Florida) and is invasive in some areas like New Caledonia.
type: The type species of the genus Turnera is Turnera diffusa (not T. ulmifolia).
T. ulmifolia is a prominent species but not the type.
synonyms: Turnera peruviana Willd. ex Roem. & Schult.
benefits: Ornamental: Bright, long-blooming flowers for borders, ground cover, or tropical gardens; attracts butterflies and bees.

Medicinal: Used traditionally as an expectorant, digestive aid, and to relieve menstrual cramps, rheumatism, wounds, and headaches. Extracts may have antimicrobial properties and potentiate antibiotics against resistant bacteria (e.g., MRSA).
Drought-tolerant: Adaptable to dry, disturbed sites.
lifeSpan: Perennial (lives multiple years). In tropical climates, it can persist 5–15 years or more with proper care (full sun/partial shade, well-drained soil). As an annual in temperate regions, it grows for one season but self-seeds readily.

name: Rubber Fig
definition: A large tropical evergreen tree or ornamental houseplant known for its thick, glossy leaves that produce a milky latex used in making natural rubber.
origin: Native to Southeast Asia, particularly India, Nepal, Myanmar, and Indonesia.
benefits: Acts as a natural air purifier by removing indoor toxins.
Improves oxygen and humidity levels indoors.
Popular ornamental plant for homes and offices.
lifeSpan: 20–50 years or more with proper care

name: Song of India
definition: A tropical evergreen shrub known for its glossy, lance-shaped leaves arranged spirally around the stem. It is a popular ornamental houseplant valued for its attractive foliage and air-purifying qualities.
origin: Native to Madagascar, Mauritius, and nearby islands in the Indian Ocean.
type: Dracaena reflexa is one of several species in the Dracaena genus.
Popular varieties include Dracaena reflexa var. angustifolia (commonly called the Song of India) and Dracaena reflexa var. reflexa (Song of Jamaica).
synonyms: Commonly referred to as Pleomele reflexa in older classifications.
benefits: Purifies indoor air by removing toxins such as formaldehyde and xylene
Enhances interior aesthetics with its lush, tropical appearance
Easy to care for and tolerant of low light conditions
Used in feng shui and indoor décor to promote tranquility and balance
lifeSpan: With proper care, Dracaena reflexa can live 10 to 15 years indoors, and even longer in ideal tropical outdoor conditions.

name: West Indian Jasmine
definition: A flowering tropical shrub known for its bright red, pink, or orange flower clusters.
origin: Native to Southern India and Sri Lanka; now common in tropical regions.
benefits: Ornamental for landscaping.
Used in traditional medicine for wounds and skin infections.
Attracts butterflies and pollinators.

name: Aratiles Tree
definition: A fast-growing tropical fruit tree known for its small, sweet red berries.
origin: Native to Southern Mexico, Central and South America.
type: Muntingia calabura (only species in its genus)
benefits: Fruits are edible and sweet.
Provides shade and attracts birds.
Used in traditional medicine for pain and inflammation.

name: Ti Plant
definition: The Ti plant, or Cordyline fruticosa, is an evergreen shrub prized for its vibrant, colorful foliage. It's often used as an ornamental plant, both indoors and outdoors, in tropical and subtropical climates.
origin: Native to Southeast Asia, Eastern Australia, and the Pacific Islands.
type: Cordyline fruticosa is the primary species, but numerous cultivars exist with varying leaf colors and patterns.
benefits: Ornamental Use: Adds color and tropical flair to gardens, patios, and indoor spaces.
Air Purification: Helps to purify indoor air by removing toxins.
Cultural Significance: Holds cultural and spiritual significance in many Polynesian societies, where it's used in ceremonies and traditional medicine.
lifeSpan: With proper care, Ti plants can live for many years, often 10 years or more, both indoors and outdoors.

name: Snake Plant
definition: A hardy ornamental plant with long upright sword-shaped leaves.
benefits: Air-purifying plant
Low maintenance indoor plant

name: Mulberry Tree
definition: A fruit-bearing tree that produces small sweet edible berries.
benefits: Produces nutritious fruits
Leaves used for silkworm rearing
Used in traditional medicine

name: Bloodberry
definition: A tropical American herb with racemes of red berries resembling those of pokeweed.
benefits: Ornamental; attracts birds
It can be use as a medicine

name: Devil's Backbone
definition: An erect succulent shrub with green, zig-zag shaped branches.
origin: Native to tropical and subtropical North America and Central America.
benefits: Ornamental plant
Used in traditional medicine (with caution)

name: Prickly Pear Cactus
definition: A cactus characterized by flat, paddle-shaped stems and spiky thorns. The prickly pear typically grows with flat, rounded cladodes (also called platyclades).
origin: Native to Mexico. The prickly pear cactus is native to the Americas.
benefits: Edible fruits (tunas/prickly pears).
Medicinal uses.
Drought resistant.
The prickly pear is packed with antioxidants that help protect the body against free radicals, which can cause cell damage and lead to chronic diseases.

name: Golden Trumpet
definition: A tropical, evergreen, perennial vine in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae). It is cultivated for its showy, golden yellow flowers.
benefits: Ornamental
Used in traditional medicine. Leaves and roots have been used as a laxative and emetic.

name: Dalandan
definition: Dalandan is a small, erect tree with smooth, greenish white shoots with spinescent thorns.
origin: Southeast Asia with origins possibly traced to China.
benefits: Rich in vitamin C, which helps boost the immune system.
Contains antioxidants that help fight free radicals.
Used in traditional medicine for colds, cough, and fever.
Helps improve skin health and wound healing.

name: Croton Pictum
definition: A tropical ornamental plant widely known for its thick, glossy, and brightly colored leaves that display combinations of green, yellow, red, orange, and purple.
benefits: Decorative foliage; improves aesthetic value
Can serve as a natural divider or accent plant in gardens
Helps create a calming and visually pleasing environment
